intro: Velleia connata, commonly known as the narrowleaf velleia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Velleia connata is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in humid tropical regions.
